page.title: 20RETIREMENT IN BUDE
page.content: 75% of retired people tend to join { {The Ever-Green Club}which organises day trips.It is run by {Flexbury {Methodist Church}and is run by local people of similar age.Many retired people feel that there should be public transport because it is too far to walk to Bude.Shopping in winter is a problem and people have to walk to the village store where prices are higher.The lane to the village is narrow and lacks a pavement. Other problems arise from the lack of local hospital facilities.Although there is a cottage hospital at {Stratton,}most people have to receive treatment at{Plymouth}or{Barnstable. } Hospital cars are provided by the{ {health authorities,}but visiting for older people is very difficult.
